response:
MRI is the gold standard to confirm the anatomical location of lesions and identify demyelinating plaques. CSF analysis and extensive serology are required to differentiate between MS, NMOSD/MOGAD, and infectious/inflammatory mimics. Visual evoked potentials confirm optic nerve dysfunction.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Spinal Cord with contrast", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Serum AQP4 antibodies", "Serum MOG antibodies", "ANA and ENA screen", "ACE levels", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Lyme serology", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF for microscopy, culture, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands)", "Visual Evoked Potentials", "Optical Coherence Tomography"]
